decision_conditions: The proposed development would by virtue of their design, scale and mass would not appear subservience to the existing dwelling and would appear incongruous, dominant and visually intrusive in the rear garden environment and front street scene contrary to policies 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (2016), policy DC61 of the London Borough of Havering LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD 2008, and the London Borough of Havering Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD 2011.

The proposed roof extensions would, by reason of its excessive scale, height, bulk and location on the boundary, be unneighbourly which would give rise to an uncomfortable and overbearing effect which would be harmful to neighbouring properties contrary to Policy DC61 of the London Borough of Havering LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD 2008, and the London Borough of Havering Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD 2011.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with adopted planning policy, notification of intended refusal and the reason(s) for it was given to Mr Aqib Ahmed via email on 18th June 2020.
description: Ground Floor Rear and Side Extensions and Loft Conversion with Front and Rear Dormers.
